author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Dagney C. Ernest)
title: Current & Coming
text:
Current & Coming By Dagney C. Ernest | Oct 01, 2015 Photo by: Dee Peppe “Picturing Maine,” a photography show drawn from the Farnsworth’s collection, opens during the First Friday Art Walk Oct. 2 with a free 5 to 8 p.m. community event. On Saturday, Oct. 3, at 2 p.m., there will be a panel discussion with Joyce Tenneson, Cig Harvey and Brenton Hamilton, whose work in in the show. Also in the show is Dee Peppe's “Old Orchard Beach, Maine, 2002,” a gelatin silver print , pictured. 
BELFAST 
Acrylics by Susan Tobey White and her students, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Thursdays through Saturdays; Sundays through Wednesdays by chance or appointment, High Street Studio & Gallery, 149 High St. FMI: 338-8990. 
African art, crafts and clothing, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays; Tuesdays and Thursdays by chance or appointment, Aina Moja at the Wellness Health Center, 39 Main St. FMI: 930-9766. 
“Art of the Line,” work by Mike Fletcher, Larason Guthrie, Bridget Matros and Julie Rose, Betts Gallery at The Belfast Framer, 96 Main St. Through Oct. 24. FMI: 338-6465. Enter through Yo Mamma’s; also entrance on Beaver Street. 
Artwork by Percy Sanborn and Hartwell Woodcock, the Belfast Civil War Quilt, exhibits depicting Belfast's maritime and industrial heritage and more, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays, Belfast Museum, 10 Market St. FMI: 338-9229. 
“The Botany of Sacrifice” interactive installation by Susan Smith; and prints by summer residency artistsJulia Talcott and Kris Sader in Corridor Gallery, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Fridays; during evening events; and by appointment, Waterfall Arts, 256 High St. FMI: 338-2222. Through Nov. 25. Artist talks (7 p.m., donation at door): Smith, Oct. 7; and Talcott, Oct. 21. 
"FARM + FOOD + FIDDLE: Grannagerie™ 2015," mixed media works by Hope Hoffman,7:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, Belfast Co-op Café, 123 High St. FMI: 338-2532. Through late October. 
“Feeding Maine: Growing Access to Good Food,” photography exhibit by Brendan Bullock; and “Harvesting Unity,” photography by Ru Allen (second floor), 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. weekdays, Maine Farmland Trust Gallery, 97 Main St. Opens with 5:30 to 8 p.m. reception Oct. 2; through Nov. 16. Open to 8 p.m. Oct. 23 for art walk. 
“Pageantry,” large-scale works on panel and small collages on paper by Daniel Anselmi, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays; 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Sundays, Perimeter Gallery at Chase’s Daily, 96 Main St. FMI: 338-0555. Through Oct. 11. 
Maine fine art and craft, Harbor Artisans artist cooperative, 60 Main St. 
Photographs of Italy by Neal Parent, new oils by Joanne Parent and jewelry by Dan Bennett, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Sundays, Parent Gallery, 92 Main St. FMI: 338-1553. 
BROOKS 
Louise Shorette: images from “A Reflection of a Journey, Sedna’s Reach,” 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Wednesdays through Sundays, Marsh River Co-op Store, Veteran’s Highway. Through Oct. 31. FMI: 722-3053. Reception 5 to 7 p.m. Oct. 17, with artist talk 5:30 p.m. 
CAMDEN 
“Camden and Rockport Revisited,” display of vintage articles from the collection of the Camden-Rockport Historical Society and the library, Picker Room of Camden Public Library. Through Oct. 31. Gallery and book talk: 7 p.m. Oct. 8. 
Harbor Arts & Books, juried show of fine arts and crafts plus used and antiquarian books, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 3; 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 4, Camden Amphitheatre, Atlantic Avenue and Camden Public Library grounds. 
“New Artists: Stan Moeller and George Van Hook” plus other gallery artists’ work, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, Camden Falls Gallery, 5 Public Landing. FMI: 470-7027. Through Oct. 31. 
FRIENDSHIP 
Photography by Dr. William Hahn; and rare paintings, photographs, models and artifacts of coasting schooners plus more from the collection, 1 to 4 p.m. Saturdays and 2 to 4 p.m. Sundays, Friendship Museum, one-room schoolhouse at 1 Martin Point Road. Through Columbus Day. 
LINCOLNVILLE 
Maine fine art and craft plus clothing, jewelry and more, Maine Artisans, 2518 Atlantic Highway/Route 1, Lincolnville Beach. Open daily through mid-October. 
Work in various media by Maine artists, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily or by appointment, Lincolnville Fine Art Gallery, 2522 Atlantic Highway/Route 1 at Lincolnville Beach. FMI: 789-5000. 
ROCKLAND 
Bartlett Woods Invitational Art Exhibit, Bartlett Woods Retirement Community, 20 Bartlett Drive. FMI: 594-2745. Third annual exhibit. 
Egg temperas and acrylics by Anna Sweeten and more, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays; chance or appointment Sundays, Harbor Square Gallery, 374 Main St. FMI: 594-8700. 
First Friday Art Walk, 5 to 8 p.m. Oct. 2, art venues on Main Street and adjacent to downtown. First Fridays through November. Season finale Nov. 27. 
“Gallery Artists,” 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Wednesdays through Sundays, Yvette Torres Fine Art, 464 Main St. (second floor). FMI: 332-4014 or (888) 777-1077. Through Oct. 25. Artists reception: 5 to 8 p.m. Oct. 2. 
“Glow,” paintings by Abbie Williams, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. weekdays; 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays; 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sundays, Archipelago Fine Arts Gallery at the Island Institute, 386 Main St. FMI: 596-0701. Through Nov. 29. First Friday reception: 5 to 8 p.m. Oct. 2. Also oil paintings by Sally Loughridge in shop in October. 
Grand opening group exhibit, noon to 8 p.m. most days, Struggling Artists Gallery, back end of Trade Winds off Winter Street. FMI: 596-6661, ext. 607. Also open during First Friday Art walks. 
Inaugural exhibition of paintings by Brigitte Gautschi, Gautschi Center for Art, Education, Creativity & Growth, 8 Elm St. 
"A Memorial Retrospective - Nancy Breed Fitzgerald," 7:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. weekdays (closed holidays), Garage Gallery at Eastern Tire & Auto Service, 70 Park St. Through late October. 
New Work by Kathleen Florance (“Tango”) and Morris David Dorenfeld (“Hunter Variations”) , noon to 4 p.m. Wednesdays through Saturdays, Caldbeck Gallery, 12 Elm St. FMI: 594-5935. Shows open with 5 to 7 p.m. reception Oct. 2; through Nov. 7. 
Paintings by Elizabeth Fox, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays; by appointment Sundays and Mondays, Dowling Walsh Gallery, 365 Main St. FMI: 596-0084. Opens with 5 to 8 p.m. reception Oct. 2; through Oct. 31. 
“People Watching,” reportage photography by Neil Reichline,plus work by Andrew Reichline and Rhonda Reichline Dubin, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays; by chance or appointment, The Fischer Gallery, second floor of 340 Main St. FMI: 542-6791. 
“Picturing Maine,” photography from the Permanent Collection, in Crosman Gallery (opens with 5 to 8 p.m. free community event Oct. 2, through March 27); “Maine Collects” (through March 6) in Morehouse Wing; “Andy and Kosti” (through Nov. 1)and “The Wyeths, Maine and the Sea” (through Jan. 3) in Wyeth Center; “Celebrating Maine,” works from the Permanent Collection, in Rothschild Gallery (through Dec. 31); “Andrew Wyeth: Maine Watercolors” in Hadlock Gallery (through November); "Worth a Thousand Words: Prints from the Farnsworth Collection" in Craig Gallery (through May 1); and “Andrew Wyeth: Portrait Studies” in Wyeth Study Center (through Dec. 31; and “Other Voices” in the Nevelson/Berliawsky Gallery, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily (to 8 p.m. First Fridays through October), Farnsworth Art Museum, 16 Museum St. Admission $12; $10 senior citizens or students older than 16; free younger than 17, museum members and all Rockland residents. FMI: 596-6457. Norman Rockwell’s New York Central Diner lecture by Stephanie Plunkett: 2 p.m. Oct. 1 ($8; $5 members). 
“Reflecting on the Edge,” photography by Elizabeth Opalenik; plus work by gallery artists, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays; appointment, Carver Hill Gallery, 338 Main St. FMI: 594-7745. Opens with 5 to 8 p.m. reception Oct. 2; through Nov. 2. 
“Reflections,” mixed media by Dorothy Simpson Krause and eco prints by Merike Van Zanten, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays; noon to 5 p.m. Sundays, Landing Gallery, 409 Main St. FMI: 239-1223. Opens with 4:30 p.m. gallery talk and 5 to 8 p.m. artists’ reception Oct. 2; through Oct. 31. 
Stained glass and wood sculpture, furniture and miniatures by Geoffrey Vollers; and paintings by Marti Reed, Geoffrey Vollers Studio, 112 South Main St./Route 73. Open by chance or appointment; call 691-4025. 
Work by Marcella Mace Christensen, John Wood and Laz Perpelitt ; plus other wildlife art including wall mural, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. weekdays, art gallery of Maine Coastal Islands National Wildlife Refuge Visitor Center, 9 Water St. Through Oct. 31. 
Work by featured members Barbara Dulac, Ann Rhinehardt and Barbara Fischer Eldred, as well as the 16 other member artists, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays; 1 to 5 p.m. Sundays, Art Space Gallery, 342 Main St. Opens with 5 to 8 p.m. reception Oct. 2; 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays after Columbus Day. 
Works on paper by Barbara Beebe and Cynthia Hyde, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays, Jonathan Frost Gallery, corner of Main Street and Park Drive. FMI: 596-0800. Through Oct. 31. 
ROCKPORT 
“Contemporary Wood Design” annual national exhibition, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. weekdays; 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturdays, Messler Gallery of the Center for Furniture Craftsmanship, intersection of Mill Street and Route 90. FMI: 594-5955. Through Jan. 6. 
“Young Artist Showcase,” juried show of work by students (age 14 to 18) in the Young Artist program at Maine Media Workshops + College, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. weekdays; 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturdays, Maine Media Gallery, ground floor of the Shepherd Building, 18 Central St. Through Oct. 31; reception 5 to 7 p.m. Oct. 9. Part of the statewide Maine Photo Project. 
ST. GEORGE 
“4 X 4, Every Painting has a Story " quartet of solo shows; and "The Ever Evolving Eclectic Extravaganza of ART” group show plus fine craft, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Fridays through Sundays or by appointment, Mars Hall Gallery, 621 Port Clyde Road/Route 131, Martinsville. FMI: 372-9996 or 372-8194. Through Columbus Day. 
Paintings and other work by member artists Kathleen Fox, Jeannette Martin, C. Wilder Oakes, Chuck Paine and Robert Schweizer, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Wednesdays through Sundays, Gallery By The Sea II, Route 131 in Port Clyde village, next to Village Ice Cream. FMI: 372-0583. 
Work by Jen Derbyshire and Katharine Cartwright, Jackson Memorial Library, 71 Main St./Route 131, Tenants Harbor. Through Oct. 6. 
SEARSPORT 
“Exploring the Magic of Photography: Painting with Light,” four exhibits and many hands-on activities as part of the Maine Photo Project; and much more, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays; noon to 5 p.m. Sundays, Penobscot Marine Museum, Main St./Route 1. Multi-building downtown campus; admissions at Main Street Gallery and Visitors Center on the Crescent, 2 Church St. Cost: $12; $10 older than 64; $8 age 7-15; $30 families; free younger than 7, members and Searsport residents; group rates available. FMI: 548-0334 or 548-2529. Through Oct. 18. 
SOUTH THOMASTON 
“Maine Color” group show, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily/Sunday and Wednesdays by chance or appointment, The Kelpie Gallery, 81 Elm St./Route 73. FMI: 691-3416 or -0392. Through Dec. 31. 
THOMASTON 
Colonial-era artifacts, art and more, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Wednesday through Fridays; 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. non-event Saturdays, Knox Museum/Montpelier, Route 131 at beginning of St. George peninsula. Cost: $10; $8 senior citizens, AAA members; $4 age 5-13; $20 family; free younger than 5, members and active military families with Military ID; $20 family; group rates available. Through Columbus Day weekend. 
“Faces of the Midcoast,” portraits by Eve M. Hupper, Thomaston Public Library, 60 Main St./Route 1. Opens with 11 a.m. reception Oct. 5; through Oct. 12. 
Open Studio Night featuring work by local artists Jill Caldwell and Stefanie Mojonnier, 5 to 8 p.m. Oct. 1, Midcoast Collaborative (MidCoLab), 12 Shepherd Drive in the Shepard Auto Plaza (adjacent to the Hampton Inn and Flagship Cinemas). Free, refreshments. 
Recent work by Sandra Mason Dickson, The Highlands Coffee House, 189 Main St./Route 1. Through Oct. 31; artist on hand for book signing Mondays noon to 2 p.m. 
WALDOBORO 
"Antipodal Visions," work from the Midcoast to Burma, Hurricane Gallery, 175 Quarry Road (off Depot Street, near Route 1). Open daily but call ahead: 832-4062 or 741-7477. 
Artist of the Month: Audrey Bechler, Waldoboro Public Library, 958 Main St./Route 220. FMI: 832-4487. Through Oct. 31. 
Geoff Bladon: new work ; plus work by gallery artists, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays, Tidemark Gallery, 902 Main St./Route 220. FMI: 832-5109. 
“New Inspirations,” recent landscape and still life paintings by Anne Heywood, Heywood Gallery, 921 Main St. FMI: 832-6684. 
Pascale Queval: works on paper and mixed media ; and work in several media by Philippe Guillerm, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tuesdays through Fridays; chance/appointment, Philippe Guillerm Gallery, 882 Main St. FMI: 701-9085. Through Oct. 2. 
WARREN 
Completed sculptures and works in progress by reclaimed metal sculptor Jay Sawyer, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sundays and Mondays, Stemwinder Sculpture Works & Gardens, 131 Camden Road/Route 90 (a quarter mile from Route 1). FMI: 273-3948. Through October. Open studio: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 3 and 4. 
WASHINGTON
